## Somatic CNA analysis

### Segments - amplifications and homozygous deletions

The following user-defined thresholds determine copy number aberrations analyzed here: 

* Copy number amplifications: LogR >= `r logR_threshold_amplification`
* Homozygous deletions: LogR <= `r logR_threshold_homozygous_deletion`

<br>
  
```{r cna_segments_nondiploid, echo=F}
myOptions <- list(paging = F, searching=F,caching=F)
if(nrow(cnv_data$ranked_segments) >= 10){
  myOptions <- list(paging = T,pageLength=10, searching=F,caching=F)
}
DT::datatable(cnv_data$ranked_segments, options = myOptions, escape=F, extensions = "Responsive") %>% DT::formatStyle('LogR',backgroundColor = DT::styleInterval(0.8, c('red', '#009E73')))
```
